page.title: 18Grinshill Quarry.
page.content: At Grinshill there is a sandstone quarry which dates back to{Roman {times. The{Thursby family}have owned the quarry since 1923. The size of the quarry is 30.50m x 300m and 5 men are employed there. {Bristar}is put in holes 1.5m deep and left over night to dry.When it dries it expands and splits the sandstone.To cut and smooth the stone they use{diamond cutters}which cost Â£3,000 per set. The sandstone that was mined from the quarry was used to build Moreton Corbet,all the churches in Shrewsbury, the railway station,and the English and Welsh bridges.Now the sandstone is used for building repairs,fireplaces and garden work.
